column4: I've got a gstreamer question (I think) if anyone can help - has anyone been having trouble in Feisty? It seems to crash when I play certain .mp3s (in the exact same place)
and I think it's gstreamer because it crashes in Rhythmbox/Banshee, but not XMMS/Amarok or from the command line with mpg321...
gstreamer troubles anyone?
explain
Banshee and Rhytmbox are crashing on some of my mp3s since upgrading to Feisty
same spot every time, and it's a seg fault
XMMS/Amaork/mpg321 do not crash, which is why I think it may be gstreamer? (does that make sense?)
what procedure did you follow to 'upgrade' to feisty?
I just used the upgrade manager, I think it was 'gksudo update-manager -c' or something like that, and just let that handle the upgrade for me
same problem on my gf's laptop, which I upgraded in the same way, though she's using Xubuntu (again, just with Banshe/Rhythmbox though)
you didn't do it right
you typed it out wrong. you need to follow directions to the letter.
sorry, I didn't type it wrong, I just typed it a couple months ago
well, go through it and try the entire thing again, it may have missed something.
alright, thanks
you can use upgrade for single packages though
wrong.
true true, just digging through the man pages, I was mistaken
upgrade will install the newest versions of ALL packages that it finds after you run apt-get update
i've been using debian for nearly a decade, i'm pretty sure ;)
haha, yeah, my mistake - is there a way to upgrade a single package then? will install check for the latest version if already installed?
just apt-get update && apt-get install <packagename>  :)
*nodding head* makes sense, thanks :)
